diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Invasive fungal infection of the stomach (gastric mucormycosis caused by Rhizopus species)
differential_diagnosis: Esophageal causes of melena (e.g., drug-induced esophagitis, reflux esophagitis, Mallory-Weiss tear, cancer)
Opportunistic infections (e.g., cytomegalovirus, herpes simplex virus, fungal organisms)
Non-infectious granulomatous diseases (e.g., Crohnâ€™s disease, sarcoidosis, lymphomas)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of invasive fungal infection was supported by the patient's underlying conditions, including chronic immunosuppression, and the finding of a large gastric ulcer during endoscopy, which exhibited features consistent with necrotic tissue and broad, nonseptate fungal hyphae. Cultures confirmed the presence of Rhizopus species, indicative of mucormycosis.
